title: Company Management
content:
Companies are vendors that provide your company with goods or services. Companies can be internal or external vendors, suppliers, distributors, service providers, cloud service providers, wholesalers, manufacturers, publishers, or customers.

In Service Management, you manage companies in the Company Management module. To manage companies, you must have the Contract manager role. For more information about this role, see Roles. To manage companies as managed customers in an MSP environment, you must have the MT Administrator role.

If your organization uses Customer Service Management (CSM), the Company Management module includes additional entities such as Product models, Product modules, Product versions, Product instances, Entitlements, Sold licenses, and Environments that help track customer products and service relationships. For details about these CSM-specific entities and how they are used in service delivery, see Company management for CSM.
